items.title: Exercise 1: Culture Audit Summary
items.text:
Results of the Q2 Culture Audit

The recent audit shows that while 'hygiene factors' like salary and office facilities are meeting expectations, employee morale has dipped. Staff reported feeling that their hard work goes unrecognized. 

We must stop focusing only on output and start fostering a culture of recognition. We tried increasing the coffee budget last month, but this had little impact on engagement. What we need is intrinsic motivation. 

I remember speaking to the team about professional development goals last year; we must ensure these are followed up. I regret to say that if turnover remains high, we will struggle to meet our Q4 targets.

questions.question: According to the audit, what is the main problem in the company?
options: Lack of recognition for hard work
questions.explanation: The text states: 'Staff reported feeling that their hard work goes unrecognized.'

questions.question: How does the meaning of 'regret' change in the last sentence?
options: It refers to a past mistake
It is used to introduce bad news in the present
It means the writer is angry
questions.explanation: 'I regret to say' is used to introduce bad news or a formal statement in the present.

items.prompt: Exercise 2: Org Psych Vocabulary. 'Staff turnover' refers to:
options: The amount of money employees earn
The rate at which employees leave and are replaced
The physical exercise employees do at lunch
The process of turning over a new leaf
items.explanation: Turnover is the metric for employee retention and replacement.

items.prompt: Exercise 3: Gerund vs. Infinitive. Complete with the correct form of 'hire': 'We stopped ____ (hire) new staff because the budget was frozen.'
items.modelAnswer: We stopped hiring new staff because the budget was frozen.

items.prompt: Exercise 4: Gerund vs. Infinitive. Complete with the correct form of 'call': 'On my way to the office, I stopped ____ (call) the HR manager about my contract.'
items.modelAnswer: On my way to the office, I stopped to call the HR manager about my contract.

items.prompt: Exercise 5: Motivation Chunks. To 'boost employee morale' means:
options: To increase the confidence and enthusiasm of the team
To fire the most enthusiastic employees
To decrease salaries across the board
To move the office to a different city
items.explanation: Boosting morale is about improving the emotional state and motivation of the workforce.
